Bio: Twin Tribes is a darkwave/post-punk duo from Texas, known for their atmospheric sound that blends haunting melodies, driving basslines, and ethereal synths. Since their formation in 2017, they have gained a dedicated following in the darkwave and goth music scenes with albums like 'Shadows' and 'Ceremony.'
AI Summary: Twin Tribes masterfully combine the brooding aesthetics of post-punk with lush, synth-driven darkwave, creating a sound that is both nostalgic and modern. Their music is characterized by moody atmospheres, hypnotic rhythms, and introspective lyrics, earning them a strong reputation in the global darkwave community.
Festival Bio (EN): Finally, we invitedTwin Tribesto Grauzone Festival 2026! Hailing from Texas, the duo mergesdarkwave, post-punk, synthpop, and goth-rockinto a sound deeply rooted in ’80s melancholy, yet delivered with a fresh, modern edge.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Having performed at Grauzone as one-half of General Dynamics (alongside William Maybelline of Lebanon Hanover/Qual), Emad Dabiri now returns under his fierce solo alias: SARIN.
Festival Bio (EN): Having performed at Grauzone as one-half of General Dynamics (alongside William Maybelline of Lebanon Hanover/Qual), Emad Dabiri now returns under his fierce solo alias: SARIN.

Bio: Nürnberg is a post-punk band from Minsk, Belarus, known for their melancholic soundscapes, atmospheric guitar work, and introspective lyrics. They have gained recognition in the Eastern European music scene for their emotionally charged performances and modern take on the post-punk genre.
AI Summary: Nürnberg combines brooding post-punk aesthetics with lush, atmospheric instrumentals and poignant lyricism, capturing a sense of emotional depth and modernity. Their music resonates with fans of the genre, particularly in Eastern Europe, where they have built a strong following.
Festival Bio (EN): Belarus post-punk duoNürnbergfrom Minsk was formed in 2016 byYury Luhautsou(vocals, bass, synths) andAleh Sautin(guitar). Their music is deeply rooted in the atmosphere of post-Soviet cities, channeling themes of depression, existentialism, social pressures, fatigue, but also the essential human capacities for love and compassion.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Mark Plant, better known under the moniker The Mall, is a St. Louis–based musician whose blistering brand of synth-punk has been carving out a unique space between punk energy and electronic intensity.
Festival Bio (EN): Mark Plant, better known under the moniker The Mall, is a St. Louis–based musician whose blistering brand of synth-punk has been carving out a unique space between punk energy and electronic intensity.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Arabian Panther is a French-Lebanese producer and DJ whose veiled presence and powerful sonic identity have made him a standout figure in the global electronic underground. Performing behind a black keffiyeh, he shifts the focus from the individual to the mythic alter ego of “the Panther”—a lone warrior devoted to justice, resistance, and unity. His music blends Middle Eastern scales, Arabic percussion, warrior-march atmospheres, and club-ready beats into an unmistakable signature inspired by hafla culture.
Festival Bio (EN): Arabian Panther is a French-Lebanese producer and DJ whose veiled presence and powerful sonic identity have made him a standout figure in the global electronic underground. Performing behind a black keffiyeh, he shifts the focus from the individual to the mythic alter ego of “the Panther”—a lone warrior devoted to justice, resistance, and unity. His music blends Middle Eastern scales, Arabic percussion, warrior-march atmospheres, and club-ready beats into an unmistakable signature inspired by hafla culture.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Desinteresse is a Dutch coldwave act formed in late 2022 by Bart Vranken (bass) and Sem van den Munckhof (vocals/synth/guitar). In 2024, Joppe de Swart (drums) joined to complete the current trio. That same year, Desinteresse made their mark with a performance at Grauzone Festival, bringing their stark and uncompromising sound to an international audience.
Festival Bio (EN): Desinteresse is a Dutch coldwave act formed in late 2022 by Bart Vranken (bass) and Sem van den Munckhof (vocals/synth/guitar). In 2024, Joppe de Swart (drums) joined to complete the current trio. That same year, Desinteresse made their mark with a performance at Grauzone Festival, bringing their stark and uncompromising sound to an international audience.

Bio: DJ Sharlese is a Seattle-based DJ and radio host known for her eclectic mix of techno, house, and experimental electronic music. She is a prominent figure in the Pacific Northwest music scene and a champion of underground and independent artists.
AI Summary: DJ Sharlese's ability to blend techno, house, and experimental sounds has made her a key figure in Seattle's electronic music scene. Her sets are celebrated for their depth and creativity, often showcasing lesser-known artists alongside established names.
Festival Bio (EN): Seattle-based DJ and radio hostSharlesethrives on the unexpected, weaving dark and diverse sounds into hypnotic sets that move between electro, EBM, Italo and techno. Her performances have lit up dance floors worldwide—from IFM in the Netherlands, Tresor West in Dortmund and Panorama Bar in Berlin, to Merge in New York. Her acclaimed mixes for podcasts such as BITE, Feinstoff and KIHDI further reveal her gift for creating intimate, emotional spaces—whether for dancing, reflection, or catharsis.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Nuxx is the electro project of New York musician and visual artist Madeline Seely, whose gritty, high-energy sound blends elements of EBM, 90's techno, drum and bass, and digital hardcore. Known for her electrifying live performances, Seely has taken Nuxx on tours across North America, Europe, and Mexico. Her high-energy sets provide the audience with a raw, immersive experience. From the festival stage to the floor of a basement, Nuxx never fucks around.
Festival Bio (EN): Nuxx is the electro project of New York musician and visual artist Madeline Seely, whose gritty, high-energy sound blends elements of EBM, 90's techno, drum and bass, and digital hardcore. Known for her electrifying live performances, Seely has taken Nuxx on tours across North America, Europe, and Mexico. Her high-energy sets provide the audience with a raw, immersive experience. From the festival stage to the floor of a basement, Nuxx never fucks around.

Bio: Helena Hauff is a German DJ and producer known for her raw, uncompromising approach to techno and electro. She has gained international acclaim for her analog-heavy productions and dynamic, high-energy DJ sets.
AI Summary: Helena Hauff's music is characterized by its gritty, analog-driven sound, blending elements of acid, industrial, and electro. Her ability to craft intense, immersive sets has made her a standout figure in the global electronic music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): A true powerhouse in electronic music,Helena Hauffhas evolved over the past decade into one of the world’s most celebrated DJs and producers. Known for her uncompromising sets—often weaving together raw acid, industrial electro, EBM, and techno—Hauff commands the dancefloor with a ferocity and precision that few can match.

Bio: Kontravoid is the solo project of Canadian artist Cameron Findlay, blending darkwave, industrial, and electronic music with haunting vocals and pulsating beats. Known for his masked stage persona, Kontravoid has gained recognition in the underground electronic scene for his atmospheric and danceable sound.
AI Summary: Kontravoid's music combines the brooding intensity of industrial and darkwave with hypnotic electronic rhythms, creating a soundscape that is both haunting and immersive. His masked performances add an enigmatic and theatrical element to his live shows, further enhancing his unique artistic identity.
Festival Bio (EN): Kontravoidhas proven to be nothing short of a crowd favourite at Grauzone. His last performance left an unforgettable impression, so much so that we knew we had to bring him back. Returning to Grauzone once more, Kontravoid, the moniker of Canadian producer and performer Cameron Findlay delivers a dark, high-energy fusion of EBM, synthpunk, industrial, darkwave, and gothic techno.

Bio: Hide was a Japanese musician, singer, and songwriter best known as the guitarist for the influential rock band X Japan. He also had a successful solo career, blending elements of alternative rock, industrial, and electronic music, and is regarded as a pioneer in the Japanese visual kei movement.
AI Summary: Hide's innovative fusion of alternative rock, industrial, and electronic elements, combined with his flamboyant visual kei aesthetic, made him a trailblazer in Japanese rock. His work with X Japan and as a solo artist has left a lasting legacy on the global rock and visual kei scenes.
Festival Bio (EN): We’re excited to presentHIDE, the uncompromising electronic duo from Chicago. Since 2014, Heather Gabel and Seth Sher have been forging a sound that blends noise, sound collage, and performance art into something uniquely visceral. With three full-length albums on Dais Records (Drab Majesty, TR/ST, Riki, Adult.), a 7" on Sub Pop, and an EP on Joyful Noise, HIDE has carved out their place in the underground as one of the most confrontational and arresting acts in modern electronic music.

Bio: Tomo Katsurada, a member of the Japanese band Kikagaku Moyo, and Jonny Nash, a British ambient musician and producer, collaborate to create introspective and atmospheric soundscapes blending acoustic and electronic elements. Their work explores minimalism and texture, drawing from folk traditions and ambient music.
AI Summary: The duo's music combines Katsurada's intricate folk-inspired guitar work with Nash's expertise in ambient production, resulting in a meditative and immersive listening experience that bridges cultural and musical boundaries.
Festival Bio (EN): We are thrilled to present Tomo & Jonny at Grauzone, an intimate project led by Japanese artist Tomo Katsurada, best known as the founding member, guitarist of the internationally acclaimed psychedelic band Kikagaku Moyo. After years of shaping one of the most influential psych-rock acts of the past decade—and performing at Grauzone with Damo Suzuki of CAN—Tomo has embarked on a deeply personal new artistic journey.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Slash Need is an industrial electronic and performance art duo from Toronto, led by Dusty Lee and Alex Low. Known for their confrontational live shows, the group merges dark electronica with dancers, elaborate makeup, and provocative visuals, creating an immersive spectacle that is as unsettling as it is liberating.Their songs slither, satirize, and scream—sonically aligned with the likes of Boy Harsher, Ministry, and Skinny Puppy. With synth-punk melodies and raw, primal vocals, Slash Need channel a collective rage against systems of power, transforming it into a defiant form of liberation.
Festival Bio (EN): Slash Need is an industrial electronic and performance art duo from Toronto, led by Dusty Lee and Alex Low. Known for their confrontational live shows, the group merges dark electronica with dancers, elaborate makeup, and provocative visuals, creating an immersive spectacle that is as unsettling as it is liberating.Their songs slither, satirize, and scream—sonically aligned with the likes of Boy Harsher, Ministry, and Skinny Puppy. With synth-punk melodies and raw, primal vocals, Slash Need channel a collective rage against systems of power, transforming it into a defiant form of liberation.

Bio: Forever Grey is a Michigan-based darkwave duo known for their melancholic soundscapes, blending brooding synths, minimalist beats, and haunting vocals. They have gained a dedicated following in the underground post-punk and darkwave scenes.
AI Summary: Forever Grey's music is characterized by its atmospheric and introspective sound, combining elements of 80s-inspired post-punk with modern darkwave aesthetics. Their emotionally resonant lyrics and moody production have cemented their place as a standout act in the genre.
Festival Bio (EN): Forever Grey is a darkwave band based out of Los Angeles, California. The first EP Poems About Eternity was released in spring of 2015 when the band was located in Grand Rapids, Michigan. The project published five cassettes in 2015 that were eventually released as the album Boundaries. Autumn Calling was released on New York based noise label Prime Ruin in 2016. The band toured in the United States, Canada and Mexico around this time. Alabaster Chamber is arguably the most important album and features the song The Style is Death. Released in 2016 by Poland based label Bat-Cave Productions. The record Departed came out on Young & Cold Records, Berlin based label in March 2020. Kevin Czarnik is the artist behind projects such as Milliken Chamber, Prudence and Belladonna Grave. Sam Kubiak is a founding member of Forever Grey. Anna Schmidt performs live and helped record the latest album Sympathy Garden.InstagramBandcampSpotifyDate: tbcLocation:tbc

She has become a key figure in Barcelona’s underground, performing in clubs such as Moog, Sidecar, Freedonia and Meteoro, while also appearing internationally in Berlin and Malta.

She has become a key figure in Barcelona’s underground, performing in clubs such as Moog, Sidecar, Freedonia and Meteoro, while also appearing internationally in Berlin and Malta.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] In just two years,Vals Alarmhas become an undeniable force in the Dutch alternative scene. Exploding onto stages with a mix of sharp-edged attitude, genre-blurring songwriting, and pure live chaos, the band quickly built a reputation for shows that feel like controlled mayhem. After a whirlwind summer playing high-energy sets atBest Kept Secret, MadNes, Wildeburg, and supportingGoldbandin a sold-outZiggo Dome, the band entered a new chapter with the release of their second EPDON’T PANIC(October 24).
Festival Bio (EN): In just two years,Vals Alarmhas become an undeniable force in the Dutch alternative scene. Exploding onto stages with a mix of sharp-edged attitude, genre-blurring songwriting, and pure live chaos, the band quickly built a reputation for shows that feel like controlled mayhem. After a whirlwind summer playing high-energy sets atBest Kept Secret, MadNes, Wildeburg, and supportingGoldbandin a sold-outZiggo Dome, the band entered a new chapter with the release of their second EPDON’T PANIC(October 24).

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] The Utrecht-based post-punk bandFIThas built a fierce reputation over the past year and a half with their explosive live shows and uncompromising energy. Their sound — a raw collision of punk urgency and funk-infused rhythm — rejects polish in favor of pure intensity.
Festival Bio (EN): The Utrecht-based post-punk bandFIThas built a fierce reputation over the past year and a half with their explosive live shows and uncompromising energy. Their sound — a raw collision of punk urgency and funk-infused rhythm — rejects polish in favor of pure intensity.

Genre: dark synthwave, ethereal techno, cinematic soundscapes
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Subject Sue is a producer and performer crafting dystopian nightclub music that merges dark synthwave, ethereal techno, and cinematic soundscapes. Her sound is textured, atmospheric, and emotionally charged—pulsating synthesizers, spectral harmonies, and percussive elements that evoke a feverish sense of dreamlike tension.
Festival Bio (EN): Subject Sue is a producer and performer crafting dystopian nightclub music that merges dark synthwave, ethereal techno, and cinematic soundscapes. Her sound is textured, atmospheric, and emotionally charged—pulsating synthesizers, spectral harmonies, and percussive elements that evoke a feverish sense of dreamlike tension.

Bio: Lydia Lunch’s Big Sexy Noise is a collaboration between iconic no wave artist Lydia Lunch and members of the British band Gallon Drunk, blending raw, abrasive noise rock with elements of blues and jazz. Known for their intense live performances and Lunch's confrontational vocal delivery, the group has carved a niche in the experimental rock scene.
AI Summary: Lydia Lunch’s Big Sexy Noise delivers a visceral mix of noise rock and blues, driven by Lydia Lunch's provocative vocals and the band's gritty instrumentation. Their music is a powerful exploration of raw emotion and sonic intensity, resonating with fans of avant-garde and experimental rock.
Festival Bio (EN): A true icon of underground music,Lydia Lunchreturns to Grauzone withBig Sexy Noise—her band with James Johnston (Nick Cave, PJ Harvey, Faust) and Ian White (Barry Adamson, Gallon Drunk). It’s the original lineup, reunited after years apart, and their raw, unapologetic sound promises to shake the walls once again.

Artist: Dj’S: The Hacker B2B Alessandro Adriani
Bio: The Hacker, a French electronic music producer known for his dark, industrial techno sound, collaborates with Alessandro Adriani, an Italian DJ and producer celebrated for his experimental and retro-futuristic approach to electronic music. Together, they bring a unique blend of industrial, EBM, and techno influences to their B2B performances.
AI Summary: The Hacker and Alessandro Adriani merge their distinct styles—dark, industrial techno and experimental, retro-futuristic electronic music—into a compelling and innovative live experience that pushes the boundaries of the genre.
Festival Bio (EN): What began as a B2B DJ set between two like-minded, seasoned veterans organically developed into a full force enthralling studio project and live set. Amato & Adriani is the new found project by Michel Amato, more commonly known as influential artist The Hacker, and producer and Mannequin Records label head honcho Alessandro Adriani. The collaboration fuses contemporary ideas with the duo's shared love for electro, EBM, Wave and the natural synergy to be found in the creative moment. Each artists production style and philosophy, when combined, elevates something new in one and other. The result, an innovative hybrid of classic sounds fueled by two creative forces working in pure synchronisation. Their debut EP, ‘Pr.sence Du Futurʼ, is set to be released by Mannequin in June 2019 and includes a special collaboration with Cabaret Voltaire singer (and founder); Stephen Malinder. A limited recording project, existing only in the now, a snapshot in time.By re-imagining their studio sessions with stripped-down, muscular sounds, foggy atmospheres and tantalizing stroboscope workouts the pair have created a show of epic proportions; Amato & Adriani are ready to bring the heat to any basement club or festival stage.The HackerAlessandro AdrianiDate: tbcTime: tbcLocation: tbc

Bio: Nghtcrwlr is the experimental noise project of Kristin Hayter, also known as Lingua Ignota. The project explores themes of trauma and catharsis through abrasive soundscapes and unconventional compositions.
AI Summary: Nghtcrwlr's music is an intense exploration of noise and experimental sound, characterized by its raw emotional depth and unflinching confrontation of difficult themes. The project pushes boundaries with its innovative approach to sound design and thematic storytelling.
Festival Bio (EN): NGHTCRWLR is the visceral solo project of Los Angeles– and New York–based artistKris Esfandiari, widely known as the voice behind the doom-gaze phenomenonKing Woman, but also featured in the short film The Runner made by Boy Harsher.  With NGHTCRWLR, Esfandiari dives into a darker, club-driven universe where industrial noise, dystopian electronics, and experimental sound design collide. Her latest albumOZ, released on the forward-thinking Swedish label YEAR0001, marks her most ambitious work yet—an apocalyptic, beat-heavy exploration of identity, desire, and disorientation.

Bio: Özgur Baba is a Turkish musician known for his mastery of the bağlama, a traditional stringed instrument, and his soulful renditions of Anatolian folk music. His music often features minimalist arrangements and deeply spiritual themes, drawing from Sufi traditions and Turkish folklore.
AI Summary: Özgur Baba's music is characterized by its meditative and minimalist approach, blending traditional Anatolian folk melodies with a spiritual depth that resonates deeply with listeners. His skillful bağlama playing and emotive vocal delivery create a timeless and introspective sound.
Festival Bio (EN): We’re delighted to welcome back hypnotic Turkish folk singerÖzgür Baba, who made his Dutch debut at Grauzone in 2020. This time, his performance will take place in a truly special setting, highlighting the depth and intimacy of his music.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] The Discussion, the brainchild of Laura Pleasants (ex-Kylesa), is gearing up for something very special: theirfirst-ever European performanceat Grauzone 2026. The Discussion was founded to mark the start of a new creative chapter following a 15-year stint with seminal heavy band Kylesa. Wanting to reconnect with her post-punk and alt-rock roots while refining her songwriting, Laura set to work, refining the concept through some solo experimentation before releasing her debut EP. Following another couple years of marination during which she released a 7” and played a handful of shows, Laura decided to go all in on The Discussion, joining forces with Jason Corbett fromACTORSin 2023 and recording her first full-length album shortly after. Building on the groundwork laid by the legends of first-wave post-punk, dark romantic new wave and goth with a distinctly modern approach that nods to the wider canons of shoegaze and death rock, The Discussion has rapidly hooked a diverse and growing fanbase with its genre-bending, decidedly dark sonic identity and lyrical content. We’re thrilled to host this exclusive European debut and witness the powerful live experience of The Discussion for the first time on our stage.
Festival Bio (EN): The Discussion, the brainchild of Laura Pleasants (ex-Kylesa), is gearing up for something very special: theirfirst-ever European performanceat Grauzone 2026. The Discussion was founded to mark the start of a new creative chapter following a 15-year stint with seminal heavy band Kylesa. Wanting to reconnect with her post-punk and alt-rock roots while refining her songwriting, Laura set to work, refining the concept through some solo experimentation before releasing her debut EP. Following another couple years of marination during which she released a 7” and played a handful of shows, Laura decided to go all in on The Discussion, joining forces with Jason Corbett fromACTORSin 2023 and recording her first full-length album shortly after. Building on the groundwork laid by the legends of first-wave post-punk, dark romantic new wave and goth with a distinctly modern approach that nods to the wider canons of shoegaze and death rock, The Discussion has rapidly hooked a diverse and growing fanbase with its genre-bending, decidedly dark sonic identity and lyrical content. We’re thrilled to host this exclusive European debut and witness the powerful live experience of The Discussion for the first time on our stage.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Lyon post-punk trio eat-girlschannel a playful yet cutting mix ofminimal synth, post-punk, kraut, dub, and pop. Still writing and recording in their bedrooms while finishing their studies, the band has already begun making waves internationally with a handful of shows abroad.
Festival Bio (EN): Lyon post-punk trio eat-girlschannel a playful yet cutting mix ofminimal synth, post-punk, kraut, dub, and pop. Still writing and recording in their bedrooms while finishing their studies, the band has already begun making waves internationally with a handful of shows abroad.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] We are excited to welcomePôt-potto Grauzone, a rising Lisbon-based psych/kosmische quintet of Irish musicians whose hypnotic fusion ofkrautrockrhythms,psychedelicglow, harmonium drones, hypnotic male–female vocal harmonies and layered textures has quickly earned them international attention.
Festival Bio (EN): We are excited to welcomePôt-potto Grauzone, a rising Lisbon-based psych/kosmische quintet of Irish musicians whose hypnotic fusion ofkrautrockrhythms,psychedelicglow, harmonium drones, hypnotic male–female vocal harmonies and layered textures has quickly earned them international attention.

Bio: Die Spitz is an all-female punk rock band from Austin, Texas, known for their raw energy, aggressive sound, and dynamic live performances that channel the spirit of classic punk with a modern edge.
AI Summary: Die Spitz delivers a ferocious blend of punk and alternative rock, marked by high-energy performances and a rebellious, unapologetic attitude. Their music captures the raw essence of punk while incorporating contemporary influences, making them a standout act in the modern punk scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Future superstars Die Spitz are ready to set the world ablaze! Hailed as “the best new band in the world,” “the most exciting new rock band on the planet” (NME), and “nothing short of fucking awesome,” the Texas quartet are taking the global music scene by storm.

Bio: Ditz is a Brighton-based post-punk band known for their abrasive sound, blending noise rock elements with politically charged lyrics and intense live performances. They have gained attention for their raw energy and confrontational style, making them a standout act in the UK underground music scene.
AI Summary: Ditz delivers a visceral mix of post-punk and noise rock, characterized by chaotic guitar riffs, aggressive vocals, and a politically charged ethos. Their live shows are renowned for their intensity and unpredictability, cementing their reputation as a bold and uncompromising act in the UK music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Queer noise-punk outfitDITZfirst played Grauzone several years ago, and we’re excited to welcome them back as one of the UK’s most uncompromising live bands. Based in Brighton, the group draws on the abrasive energy of The Jesus Lizard and Shellac, while embracing the jagged post-punk of The Fall and the modern intensity of Gilla Band and Model/Actriz.

Bio: The Chisel is a UK-based band blending the raw energy of Oi! and punk with politically charged lyrics, delivering a powerful and aggressive sound. Known for their high-energy live performances, they have quickly gained recognition in the punk scene.
AI Summary: The Chisel's fusion of Oi! and punk, combined with their socially conscious lyrics, creates a visceral and authentic sound that resonates with fans of raw, politically driven music. Their live shows are celebrated for their intensity and connection with audiences.
Festival Bio (EN): Straight from the same UK punk underground that birthedHigh Vis,who blew the roof off Grauzone 2025.The Chiselare one of the most urgent and unrelenting voices in today’s new wave of British punk. Their sound fuses the raw energy of UK82 street punk with hardcore grit and catchy pub-rock melodies, channeling influences like Blitz and Angelic Upstarts

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] From Morocco to France to some of Europe’s most iconic stages,Zaatarhas been redefining what body music can sound like. Blending her Moroccan heritage with EBM, New Beat, and Trance, she has quickly emerged as one of the most exciting new forces in the scene.
Festival Bio (EN): From Morocco to France to some of Europe’s most iconic stages,Zaatarhas been redefining what body music can sound like. Blending her Moroccan heritage with EBM, New Beat, and Trance, she has quickly emerged as one of the most exciting new forces in the scene.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] One of the most exciting bands around right now, The NONE are a lean, mean, fighting punk rock machine – a furious and intense new outfit that’s already proving to be the real deal. Formed from members of Bloc Party, Cassels, Frauds and more, The NONE’s sound is a collapsing, industrial-tinged post-hardcore racket honed through a string of explosive live shows in 2024.
Festival Bio (EN): One of the most exciting bands around right now, The NONE are a lean, mean, fighting punk rock machine – a furious and intense new outfit that’s already proving to be the real deal. Formed from members of Bloc Party, Cassels, Frauds and more, The NONE’s sound is a collapsing, industrial-tinged post-hardcore racket honed through a string of explosive live shows in 2024.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Graaf Drankula, one of Jordi Ariza Gallego's alter egos, is the theatrical deejay better known as one of the founders of the Amsterdam queer family UltraSexi. Under this banner, notorious queer nights were organized such as M.U.L.T.I.S.E.X.I. and the slightly hysterical pop-culture party F*CKING POP QUEERS! As a disc jockey, the Count fills the dance floor with intense queer love beats, carefree yet manic, taken on a homo-eclectic journey across genres and eras.
Festival Bio (EN): Graaf Drankula, one of Jordi Ariza Gallego's alter egos, is the theatrical deejay better known as one of the founders of the Amsterdam queer family UltraSexi. Under this banner, notorious queer nights were organized such as M.U.L.T.I.S.E.X.I. and the slightly hysterical pop-culture party F*CKING POP QUEERS! As a disc jockey, the Count fills the dance floor with intense queer love beats, carefree yet manic, taken on a homo-eclectic journey across genres and eras.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] We’re proud to presentAvishag Cohen Rodriguesat Grauzone and will perform her very first Dutch show. Known as the guitarist of New York’s rising post-punk bandCumgirl8(4AD), Rodrigues is also a multi-instrumentalist, producer, and solo artist with a deeply personal sound.
Festival Bio (EN): We’re proud to presentAvishag Cohen Rodriguesat Grauzone and will perform her very first Dutch show. Known as the guitarist of New York’s rising post-punk bandCumgirl8(4AD), Rodrigues is also a multi-instrumentalist, producer, and solo artist with a deeply personal sound.

Bio: Jehnny Beth is a French musician, singer, and songwriter best known as the frontwoman of the post-punk band Savages. She has also released solo work, blending dark, brooding art rock with experimental and electronic elements, and has collaborated with artists like Gorillaz and Trentemøller.
AI Summary: Jehnny Beth's music is characterized by its intense, visceral energy and a blend of post-punk rawness with avant-garde and electronic influences. Her commanding stage presence and collaborations with prominent artists have solidified her reputation as a bold and innovative force in modern music.
Festival Bio (EN): After playing one of her first-ever solo shows (on piano) at Grauzone 2017, we are thrilled to welcome back Jehnny Beth — this time with her full band!

Bio: Pixel Grip is a Chicago-based trio known for their dark, pulsating synthpop and electronic soundscapes, blending elements of industrial, goth, and house music. Their music often explores themes of identity, queerness, and empowerment, earning them a dedicated following in the underground electronic scene.
AI Summary: Pixel Grip combines brooding darkwave textures with infectious synthpop hooks, creating a sound that is both danceable and emotionally resonant. Their exploration of queer themes and bold, theatrical performances have positioned them as a standout act in the modern electronic music landscape.
Festival Bio (EN): Chicago-based electronic trio Pixel Grip have been making waves since 2019 with their multifaceted, high-voltage synth sound — a visceral blend of darkwave, pop, and industrial grit. Fronted by Rita Lukea with Jonathon Freund on synths and Tyler Ommen on drums, the group has built a cult following for their seductive, avant-garde aesthetic and electrifying live shows.

Bio: Kompromat is a French electronic music duo formed by Vitalic and Rebeka Warrior, blending industrial techno with darkwave and EBM influences. Known for their intense live performances and politically charged lyrics, they have gained recognition for their unique sound and bold artistic vision.
AI Summary: Kompromat's fusion of industrial techno, darkwave, and EBM creates a raw, pulsating soundscape. Their politically infused lyrics and high-energy performances have positioned them as a standout act in the electronic music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Kompromat is the electrifying collaboration between Vitalic and queer iconRebeka Warrior, who also runs the fierce and boundary-pushingWarrior Records. With their latest releasePLДYING / PRДYING(2024) out now on Warrior Records — also home to Minuit Machine and Cate Hortl — the duo fuses EBM, cold wave, and radical techno into an ecstatic ritual of sound. The duo revels in blurring boundaries. While German lyrics accompanied their first album, their new narratves will be channeled in English. Known for their intense performances and sonic storytelling, we’re proud to welcome Kompromat to Grauzone 2026 as they bring their new record to life.Date: tbcLocation: Tbc

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Emerging from New York’s underground with a striking artistic vision,Stella Rosehas quickly become one of the most captivating new voices in dark pop. Daughter of Depeche Mode frontmanDave Gahan, Stella has carved her own unique path—merging brooding guitars, visceral lyricism, and haunting vocals into music that feels both poetic and raw, drawing inspiration from icons such as Patti Smith, PJ Harvey, Nick Cave, and David Bowie.
Festival Bio (EN): Emerging from New York’s underground with a striking artistic vision,Stella Rosehas quickly become one of the most captivating new voices in dark pop. Bio: DJ Jen Cardini is a French electronic music artist known for her eclectic blend of house, techno, and disco. She has gained international recognition for her dynamic DJ sets and her work as the founder of the record labels Correspondant and Dischi Autunno.
AI Summary: Jen Cardini's ability to seamlessly fuse house, techno, and disco with a sophisticated and eclectic approach has made her a standout figure in the electronic music scene. Her work as a label founder further showcases her dedication to fostering innovative sounds and emerging talent.
Festival Bio (EN): One of the most prominent and respected artists to emerge from the French electronic music scene, Jennifer Cardini has become a cornerstone of European club culture. Although best known for sounds that sit somewhere between seductive house, dark italo, and coldwave, Cardini effortlessly moves between sleek techno, sexy EBM, and moments of hands-in-the-air rave euphoria.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] From the very beginning, Larissa Iceglass has been a beloved part of the Grauzone family. As one half of the iconic duoLebanon Hanover, she has performed at Grauzone several times.This time, however, she returns with something entirely new,  and we’re super proud to host the live premiere of her latest project at Grauzone 2026.

Bio: Sydney Valette is a French electronic music artist known for his blend of synthwave, darkwave, and post-punk influences. His music combines retro synthesizer sounds with modern electronic production, creating a moody and atmospheric style.
AI Summary: Sydney Valette's music is a compelling mix of retro synthwave and darkwave, characterized by brooding atmospheres and pulsating electronic beats. His ability to merge nostalgic 80s-inspired sounds with contemporary production has earned him a dedicated following in the underground electronic scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Paris-basedSydney Valettefuses EBM, ambient, goth wave, Italo-Disco, synth-punk and more. While influenced by sounds of the past, his music sounds fresh and unique.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Nation Unrestis a London-based EBM duo that channels the physical urgency of early electronic body music through the raw, uncompromising spirit of UK punk. Formed byCal Graham(vocalist of street-punk actThe Chisel,who will perform during Grauzone!) andJoshua Smith(Chain of Flowers), the project strips their sound to its core: hard rhythm electronics driven by analog gear, militant percussion, and dystopian intent.
Festival Bio (EN): Nation Unrestis a London-based EBM duo that channels the physical urgency of early electronic body music through the raw, uncompromising spirit of UK punk. Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Amsterdam new hardcore punksUitzendbureau(in english:Employment agency)hit hard – relentless in both sound and message. Loud, chaotic, and uncompromising, they deliver an explosion of raw energy and unfiltered noise: raging against the police, dystopia, and the established order. It’s brutal, it’s messy, and it’s unforgettable.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Safe Mind is the brand new collaboration betweenAugustus Muller(Boy Harsher) andCooper B. Handy(aka LUCY). Their debut album Cutting The Stone was released on July 25, 2025 through Nude Club Records, Boy Harsher’s own imprint, and has quickly established the duo as one of the label’s most exciting new acts.Cooper B. Handy is no stranger to the Boy Harsher universe — he provided the distinctive vocals on their track Automatic, a fan favorite that highlighted the chemistry between his voice and Muller’s production. With Safe Mind, that synergy now takes center stage.

Bio: Home Front is a Canadian band that blends post-punk and new wave influences, creating a sound reminiscent of 1980s synth-driven rock with a modern edge. Their music is characterized by driving rhythms, melodic synth lines, and anthemic vocals.
AI Summary: Home Front's music captures the energy of 1980s post-punk and new wave, combining nostalgic synth-driven melodies with a fresh, contemporary approach. Their sound is both energetic and atmospheric, appealing to fans of retro-inspired yet forward-thinking music.
Festival Bio (EN): Canadian band Home Front fuse Oi! punk energy with 80s synth pop melancholia to create their own fresh take on shoegaze – or rather:Boot Gaze.

Bio: Mint Field is a Mexican band known for their dreamy blend of shoegaze, psychedelic rock, and post-rock elements. Formed in Tijuana, their music features lush, atmospheric soundscapes and introspective lyrics, earning them recognition in the global indie music scene.
AI Summary: Mint Field's music is characterized by ethereal vocals, reverb-drenched guitars, and a hypnotic fusion of shoegaze and psychedelic rock, drawing comparisons to bands like Slowdive and My Bloody Valentine. Their ability to create immersive sonic textures has garnered critical acclaim and a dedicated following.
Festival Bio (EN): Mint Fieldbrings their lush, shoegaze-infused psych rock from Mexico to Grauzone for the very first time and it’s about time! Hailing from Tijuana and now based in Mexico City, the band led byEstrella del Sol Sánchezhas carved out a unique space within the global underground scene. Their dreamy, immersive sound draws onshoegaze,krautrock,post-rock, andpsychedelictextures, combining ethereal vocals, intricate guitar work, and deep emotional resonance.

Bio: Whitelands is a London-based band blending shoegaze and dream pop with introspective lyrics and lush, atmospheric soundscapes. They have gained attention for their emotive songwriting and ethereal melodies, creating a unique and immersive listening experience.
AI Summary: Whitelands crafts a captivating fusion of shoegaze and dream pop, marked by hazy guitar textures, heartfelt lyrics, and a melancholic yet uplifting atmosphere. Their ability to evoke deep emotions through layered instrumentation and poignant themes has garnered them a growing following in the alternative music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Whitelands are a four-piece London-based Black British shoegaze and dreampop band, standing at the forefront of a new generation of Black British guitar music alongside Big Joanie and Bob Vylan. Their acclaimed debutNight-Bound Eyes Are Blind to the Daywas released on February 23, 2024 via Sonic Cathedral (Bdrmm, Horsegirl), during their UK tour supporting shoegaze icons Slowdive. In June 2024, NME hailed it as one of the best debut albums of the year so far, leading to widespread radio support, including playlists on BBC Radio 6 Music.

Bio: DJ I-F, also known as Ferenc van der Sluijs, is a Dutch electronic music producer and DJ renowned for his pioneering work in the electro and Italo disco genres. He gained prominence in the 1990s with his influential track 'Space Invaders Are Smoking Grass' and is also known for founding the influential internet radio station Intergalactic FM.
AI Summary: DJ I-F is celebrated for his groundbreaking contributions to electro and Italo disco, blending retro-futuristic sounds with innovative production. His work, particularly the cult classic 'Space Invaders Are Smoking Grass,' has had a lasting impact on electronic music, and his role in establishing Intergalactic FM has cemented his status as a tastemaker in underground electronic scenes.
Festival Bio (EN): Finally—I-Fat Grauzone, right here in The Hague, the city that has been both his home and the base for his legendary Intergalactic FM radio station. A cornerstone of electronic music, I-F has shaped generations of DJs and listeners since the early 1990s, with a legacy that spans from pirate radio to cult record labels Viewlexx and Murdercapital.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Neu Romancer is no stranger to Grauzone. The Berlin-based producer previously performed synths live for Zanias and has since launched her own solo project, with releases on the renowned Fleisch Records label. Known for her sultry DJ sets blendingItalo disco,EBM, and hypnotic, dancefloor-ready beats, she brings a distinct energy that never fails to move a crowd.
Festival Bio (EN): Neu Romancer is no stranger to Grauzone. Known for her sultry DJ sets blendingItalo disco,EBM, and hypnotic, dancefloor-ready beats, she brings a distinct energy that never fails to move a crowd.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Sad Madona is a solo electro/synth project from Paris that blends elements of gothic, techno, and shoegaze into what creator Rémi Lauvergne describes as “dramatic dance.” The music was already picked up by techno icon Ellen Allien, who has praised Sad Madona’s sound — and previously performed at Grauzone herself and made a remix of the song Witch Coast.
Festival Bio (EN): Sad Madona is a solo electro/synth project from Paris that blends elements of gothic, techno, and shoegaze into what creator Rémi Lauvergne describes as “dramatic dance.” The music was already picked up by techno icon Ellen Allien, who has praised Sad Madona’s sound — and previously performed at Grauzone herself and made a remix of the song Witch Coast.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Grote Geelstaart is one of the Netherlands’ most exciting new noise-rock acts, known for their wild genre-switching, explosive energy, and theatrical stage presence. Their live shows feel like being strapped into a runaway car: two drummers push the tempo to its limits, the bass locks into hypnotic drones, and the vocals oscillate between shouts, screams, whispers, and unhinged proclamations.
Festival Bio (EN): Grote Geelstaart is one of the Netherlands’ most exciting new noise-rock acts, known for their wild genre-switching, explosive energy, and theatrical stage presence. Their live shows feel like being strapped into a runaway car: two drummers push the tempo to its limits, the bass locks into hypnotic drones, and the vocals oscillate between shouts, screams, whispers, and unhinged proclamations.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] The Etters began as a chaotic idea born from a midlife crisis—and quickly evolved into one of the most unmistakably fun garage-punk acts in the Netherlands. When vocalistJerry(former singer of The Jerry Hormone Ego Trip) hit a crisis point at 42, his counselor offered two options: buy a Harley-Davidson, or start a loud band with two younger punk musicians. Broke but motivated, he chose the latter, teaming up withLuna(bass) andKate Oram (Chattermag)(drums) to form The Etters.
Festival Bio (EN): The Etters began as a chaotic idea born from a midlife crisis—and quickly evolved into one of the most unmistakably fun garage-punk acts in the Netherlands. When vocalistJerry(former singer of The Jerry Hormone Ego Trip) hit a crisis point at 42, his counselor offered two options: buy a Harley-Davidson, or start a loud band with two younger punk musicians. Broke but motivated, he chose the latter, teaming up withLuna(bass) andKate Oram (Chattermag)(drums) to form The Etters.

Bio: Warmduscher is a London-based band known for their eclectic mix of post-punk, funk, and alternative rock, blending gritty, raw energy with a playful and experimental approach. They have gained a reputation for their electrifying live performances and unique sound that draws from diverse influences.
AI Summary: Warmduscher's music is a chaotic yet infectious fusion of post-punk, funk, and alternative rock, characterized by gritty vocals, groovy basslines, and a tongue-in-cheek attitude. Their live shows are celebrated for their high energy and unpredictable, boundary-pushing performances.
Festival Bio (EN): London’s own mischief-makers Warmduscher return with their fifth albumToo Cold To Hold, and it’s their boldest yet. Where many bands settle into formula by album five, Warmduscher explode in every direction—pulling in the hypnotic grooves of South African gqom, touches of hip hop, disco-punk chaos, and even jazz. The result is a glorious mess of rhythm and attitude, a 12-legged groove machine powered by Clams Baker Jr., Benjamin Romans Hopcraft, Adam J. Harmer, Marley Mackey, Quinn Whalley, and Bleu Ottis Wright.

Bio: Potochkine is a French electronic duo blending darkwave, synthpop, and industrial sounds with poetic and theatrical performances. Known for their intense live shows, they create a unique fusion of haunting melodies and pulsating rhythms.
AI Summary: Potochkine's music is a compelling mix of darkwave and industrial influences, characterized by atmospheric synths, driving beats, and a dramatic, avant-garde stage presence. Their work stands out for its emotional depth and innovative approach to electronic music.
Festival Bio (EN): Toulon electronic/ techno / dark wave/ ebm duo Potochkine; Pauline Alcaïdé and Hugo Sempé, merge the pulsating energy of dance EBM with the enchanting allure of French chanson, creating a sound that is as poetic as it is powerful. Since their 2016 debut EP Libérez votre imagination, the pair have carved their own world of dark, theatrical electronics — equal parts body, blood, and poetry.

Straight from Rotterdam’s underground,Fellatiodescribe themselves as anavant-garde disco-punk post-penis kraut-rock trio— a wild collision of rhythm, repetition, and existential tension. Their hypnotic, pulsating sound blends raw performance energy with mechanical groove, creating something both absurd and deeply compelling.

Bio: Lust For Youth is a Danish electronic music project known for their blend of melancholic synthpop and darkwave influences. Originally a solo project by Hannes Norrvide, it later evolved into a trio, gaining critical acclaim for their atmospheric soundscapes and emotive melodies.
AI Summary: Lust For Youth combines brooding darkwave aesthetics with shimmering synthpop melodies, creating a nostalgic yet modern sound. Their music has been praised for its emotional depth and evocative production, making them a standout in the contemporary electronic scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Lust for Youth is a Danish–Swedish electronic duo known for their evocative fusion of synthpop, post-punk, and darkwave. Formed in Gothenburg and now based in Copenhagen, the project began as the solo venture of Hannes Norrvide before evolving into a collaboration with Malthe Fischer, whose crystalline production and synthesizer work brought a new depth to the project’s sound. Their music captures both the melancholic and the euphoric,  a shimmering tension between detachment and desire.

Bio: Frustration is a French post-punk band known for their raw energy and dark, driving sound, blending influences from 1980s post-punk and new wave with a modern edge. They have gained a strong following in the European underground music scene with their intense live performances and critically acclaimed albums.
AI Summary: Frustration's music combines angular guitar riffs, pulsating basslines, and brooding vocals, evoking the spirit of bands like Joy Division and Wire while maintaining a distinct contemporary edge. Their reputation for electrifying live shows and their ability to channel raw emotion into their music have made them a standout in the European post-punk revival.
Festival Bio (EN): A cornerstone of the French post-punk landscape,Frustrationfinally makes their long-awaited debut at Grauzone. Formed in Paris in 2002 by members of the city’s thriving punk underground (Operation S, No Talents, Steve & The Jerks, Les Terribles), the band set out to embrace the coldest, tensest edges of rock music. Their influences—Crisis, Warsaw/Joy Division, The Fall, Killing Joke—shape a sound that’s raw, direct, and unmistakably urgent.

Bio: The Serfs are a Cincinnati-based band blending post-punk aesthetics with synth-driven grooves, creating a dark, danceable sound that draws from 80s new wave and industrial influences. Known for their energetic live performances, they have gained a cult following in the underground music scene.
AI Summary: The Serfs craft a unique fusion of brooding post-punk and pulsating synthwave, marked by their atmospheric soundscapes and infectious rhythms. Their music resonates with fans of retro-inspired yet forward-thinking electronic rock.
Festival Bio (EN): Straight out of southwestern Ohio,The Serfsare a deliberately elusive collective whose sound channels industrial rhythms, metallic percussion, and hypnotic synth melodies. Their music feels like it was unearthed from a forgotten factory floor, mechanical yet strangely human, a dancefloor ritual wrapped in grit and electricity.

Bio: Minuit Machine is a French electronic music duo formed in 2013, known for their melancholic and emotional darkwave sound that blends coldwave influences with modern synth-driven beats. The duo, composed of Amandine Stioui and Hélène de Thoury, has gained recognition for their atmospheric compositions and introspective lyrics.
AI Summary: Minuit Machine's music is characterized by its haunting darkwave aesthetic, combining cold, pulsating synths with emotive vocals to create a deeply immersive and melancholic soundscape. Their work has been praised for its ability to evoke powerful emotions while maintaining a distinct, modern edge.
Festival Bio (EN): Hailing from Paris,Minuit Machineis another act that has won the hearts of the Grauzone audience. The project, led byAmandine Stioui, returns to the festival stage following a widely praised past performance—and now, with a powerful new release titledQueendom.

Bio: Traitrs is a Canadian post-punk and darkwave duo known for their atmospheric soundscapes, melancholic melodies, and brooding lyrics. Their music draws inspiration from the gothic and post-punk movements of the 1980s, blending haunting vocals with cinematic instrumentation.
AI Summary: Traitrs craft a dark, immersive sound that combines the moody aesthetics of 1980s post-punk with modern darkwave elements, earning them a dedicated following in the alternative music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Toronto’s internationally acclaimed post-punk duo TRAITRS are coming to Grauzone with their new album Possessor, out early 2026.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] For the first time in Europe, Los Angeles-based Deceits brings their heartfelt, melodic post-punk to Grauzone. Influenced by The Cure and Human Tetris, the trio’s debutIf There’s No Heaven...blends goth, shoegaze, and dream pop into emotionally charged songs. Their appearance marks a special moment we’re proud to host.InstagramSpotifyBandcampDate: tbcStage: tbc

Bio: Sixth June is a Serbian synthpop and darkwave duo formed by Laslo Antal and Lidija Andonov. Known for their atmospheric soundscapes and nostalgic 80s-inspired electronic music, they have gained a dedicated following in the underground electronic music scene.
AI Summary: Sixth June masterfully blends melancholic synth melodies with darkwave aesthetics, creating a sound that is both hauntingly retro and refreshingly modern. Their music is characterized by cinematic textures, brooding vocals, and a deep connection to the 80s electronic era.
Festival Bio (EN): After years of anticipation,Sixth Juneare finally coming to Grauzone. Formed in 2007 by visual artist Laslo Antal and actress Lidija Andonov, the Berlin-based duo has released several albums across respected labels including Mannequin Records, aufnahme+wiedergabe, Cleopatra, and Young and Cold. Since 2020, they’ve released music via their own label, Sweet Sensation.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Neu Romancer is no stranger to Grauzone. The Berlin-based producer previously performed synths live for Zanias and has since launched her own solo project, with releases on the renowned Fleisch Records label. Known for her sultry DJ sets blendingItalo disco,EBM, and hypnotic, dancefloor-ready beats, she brings a distinct energy that never fails to move a crowd.
Festival Bio (EN): Neu Romancer is no stranger to Grauzone. The Berlin-based producer previously performed synths live for Zanias and has since launched her own solo project, with releases on the renowned Fleisch Records label. Known for her sultry DJ sets blendingItalo disco,EBM, and hypnotic, dancefloor-ready beats, she brings a distinct energy that never fails to move a crowd.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Luigi Pianezzola arrives with a distinct and destructive sound on his debut record, II.The Bassano del Grappa-based producer andThe Soft Moontouring musician makes stark electronic tracks which pull from punk, industrial and club music while retaining a modern grit of his own. In his solo project, TORBA, Pianezzola delves into the darker realms of post-punk, dark wave, and industrial music.During the global pandemic, he channeled the solitude of quarantine into his creative process, resulting in compositions that reflect the era’s uncertainty.II follows a debut self-titled EP released in late 2023, where Pianezzola discovered his signature approach with the help of producer Maurizio Baggio(The Soft Moon, Boy Harsher). They worked for an intense week at La Distilleria studio.TORBA’s music offers a visceral experience, characterized by distorted undertones and evocative lyrics that explore themes of dislocation and existential estrangement.Torba flits between angry and energetic offerings like ‘PUNTO’ and more reflective instrumentals. ‘SIDES’ and ‘ONDA’ are built on slow-moving climaxes, rhythmic playfulness and an enveloping nocturnal atmosphere. Giddy curiosity connects the two sides, as does a sense of danger. “I like to use acoustic sounds or samples and then I over-process to destroy it one piece at a time,” Pianezzola says. “I love to use bit reduction and digital distortion to keep just the tone and try to destroy everything else, to get to the very essence of the sound. Through TORBA, Luigi Pianezzola crafts a mechanical lamentation of a civilization lulled by industrial noise, with skies darkened by the end of the sun—a soundless cry marked by the eerie echo of silence
Festival Bio (EN): Luigi Pianezzola arrives with a distinct and destructive sound on his debut record, II.The Bassano del Grappa-based producer andThe Soft Moontouring musician makes stark electronic tracks which pull from punk, industrial and club music while retaining a modern grit of his own. In his solo project, TORBA, Pianezzola delves into the darker realms of post-punk, dark wave, and industrial music.During the global pandemic, he channeled the solitude of quarantine into his creative process, resulting in compositions that reflect the era’s uncertainty.II follows a debut self-titled EP released in late 2023, where Pianezzola discovered his signature approach with the help of producer Maurizio Baggio(The Soft Moon, Boy Harsher). They worked for an intense week at La Distilleria studio.TORBA’s music offers a visceral experience, characterized by distorted undertones and evocative lyrics that explore themes of dislocation and existential estrangement.Torba flits between angry and energetic offerings like ‘PUNTO’ and more reflective instrumentals. ‘SIDES’ and ‘ONDA’ are built on slow-moving climaxes, rhythmic playfulness and an enveloping nocturnal atmosphere. Giddy curiosity connects the two sides, as does a sense of danger. “I like to use acoustic sounds or samples and then I over-process to destroy it one piece at a time,” Pianezzola says. “I love to use bit reduction and digital distortion to keep just the tone and try to destroy everything else, to get to the very essence of the sound. Through TORBA, Luigi Pianezzola crafts a mechanical lamentation of a civilization lulled by industrial noise, with skies darkened by the end of the sun—a soundless cry marked by the eerie echo of silence

Bio: Youth Code is an American duo known for their aggressive fusion of industrial and EBM (Electronic Body Music), blending harsh electronics with punk-inspired energy. Since their formation in 2012, they have gained a dedicated following for their intense live performances and raw, visceral sound.
AI Summary: Youth Code's music combines the abrasive textures of industrial and EBM with a punk ethos, creating a visceral and cathartic sonic experience. Their high-energy live shows and uncompromising sound have earned them critical acclaim within the industrial and electronic music scenes.
Festival Bio (EN): American EBM virtuososYouth Code— the powerhouse duo of Sara Taylor and Ryan George — return with their first new release in five years:Yours, With Malice, released in 2025 on Sumerian Records.

Bio: Male Tears is a Los Angeles-based synthpop and darkwave project known for its retro-inspired sound, blending 80s new wave aesthetics with modern electronic production. The act has gained attention for its nostalgic yet fresh take on synth-driven music, often exploring themes of identity and emotion.
AI Summary: Male Tears delivers a captivating mix of 80s-inspired synthpop and darkwave, characterized by moody atmospheres, catchy melodies, and introspective lyrics. Their music stands out for its ability to balance retro influences with contemporary electronic elements, appealing to fans of both classic and modern synth-driven genres.
Festival Bio (EN): LA synth pop bandMale Tearsare described as a "goth's love affair with 1980s new wave" blending darkwave, goth rock, EBM, new romantic and futurepop, creating a sound they call "Dark Rave". Releasing records on Avant Records (Nuovo Testamento, Buzz Kull, SDH, Qual) they began as a post-pandemic art project, founded by singer-songwriterJames Edward, and has since mutated into a full-fledgedweirdo-popfour-piece. Rooted in Edward’s taste for irony, camp, and erratically applied makeup, the band delivers a playful yet biting take on underground music culture. Their sound merges synth-driven pop, goth undertones, and a flair for melodrama, balancing catchy hooks with a satirical edge.

Bio: Years Of Denial is a French electronic music duo known for their dark and atmospheric blend of industrial, darkwave, and techno influences. Their music often explores themes of emotional intensity and existentialism, with a focus on haunting vocals and pulsating beats.
AI Summary: Years Of Denial crafts a brooding soundscape that merges industrial harshness with darkwave melodies and techno rhythms, creating a deeply immersive and emotionally charged listening experience. Their work stands out for its raw intensity and evocative vocal performances.
Festival Bio (EN): Years of DenialFrench/Czech duoYears of Denialis the collaborative force of French musicianJerome Tcherneyanand Czech performance artistBarkosina Hanusova. Active since 2016, the duo has earned an international reputation for their sharp productions and electrifying live shows.Using hardware electronics, dub-treated sound design and Barkosina’s unmistakable, haunting vocals, Years of Denial bridge the dark edges ofpost-punk, EBM, industrial, new beat and rave culture. Their performances fuse relentless rhythms and pulsating arpeggios with heavy electronics and psychedelic atmospherics, creating an intense, shadow-drenched world on the dance floor.Their acclaimed “Suicide Disco” sound—coined by the band themselves—has defined two standout LPs on Veyl Records (2019 & 2023), supported by powerful remix EPs featuring Silent Servant, Orphx, Broken English Club, The Hacker and more.The duo creates a deeply immersive atmosphere, vigorously keeping dancers on their toes and moving from the night’s darkest corners to the dawn of day.We’re very happy to welcome Years of Denial to Grauzone.

Genre: alternative rock, new wave, chanson française
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] OH NON (Fr)OH NON is a French quintet operating at the crossroads of alternative rock, new wave, and eccentric chanson française. Drawing inspiration from Boris Vian, Brigitte Fontaine, Stereo Total, Pixies, and B-52’s, their music is playful, theatrical, razor-sharp, and utterly unpredictable. With humor, irony, and emotional vulnerability woven throughout their lyrics, OH NON tackles modern anxieties—urban alienation, nightlife absurdities, and the awkward negotiations of human relationships—all delivered through surreal, witty, and highly energetic songwriting.Their universe is rich with its own symbols, logic, and offbeat charm. Switching effortlessly between buzzing guitars, disco-infused grooves, scat-like vocal textures, noise bursts, and deadpan spoken-word, they occupy a unique niche in the French musical landscape: too strange for pop, too melodic for pure punk, too fun for the avant-garde—and beloved by audiences who feel equally “in between.”In 2024, OH NON released their first self-titled EP, a six-track introduction to their dreamlike and burlesque world. The lead singleLes Filles des Filmsset the tone with a surreal video that quickly captured attention. In 2025, they returned with the surf-styled singleCaïman, a cinematic mini-story about a woman walking her pet caiman through Paris—a whimsical, biting metaphor for modern chaos.OH NON brings together the grumpiest and the shyest, the punks and the romantics, around a shared love for oddball beauty and inclusivity. We are excited to welcome OH NON to Grauzone, where their eccentric universe will shine.Date: tbcTime: tbcLocation: tbcInstagramBandcamp

The lead singleLes Filles des Filmsset the tone with a surreal video that quickly captured attention. In 2025, they returned with the surf-styled singleCaïman, a cinematic mini-story about a woman walking her pet caiman through Paris—a whimsical, biting metaphor for modern chaos.OH NON brings together the grumpiest and the shyest, the punks and the romantics, around a shared love for oddball beauty and inclusivity. We are excited to welcome OH NON to Grauzone, where their eccentric universe will shine.Date: tbcTime: tbcLocation: tbcInstagramBandcamp

Bio: Des Demonas is a Washington, D.C.-based band known for their raw, energetic garage rock sound infused with punk and psychedelic influences. Their music often features politically charged lyrics and a distinct organ-driven style.
AI Summary: Des Demonas delivers a high-energy blend of garage rock and punk, characterized by their use of vintage organ sounds and politically charged themes. Their music captures the raw intensity of classic punk while incorporating psychedelic and garage rock elements.
Festival Bio (EN): Des Demonas (US)Led byKenyan-born frontman Jacky “Cougar” Abok, Washington DC'sDes Demonasfuse garage-punk ferocity with the rhythmic intensity of Afrobeats, funk, and psych rock. Their music hits like a fever dream — sharp, soulful, and politically charged — propelled by Abok’s commanding presence and the band’s volcanic groove.Formed out of D.C.’s thriving punk and garage underground, the lineup features some serious pedigree: guitarist Mark Cisneros (Kid Congo& the Pink Monkey Birds, The Make-Up), organist/bassist Paul Vivari (Benjy Ferree, DJ Soul Call Paul), and drummer Matt Gatwood (Halpine, Two Inch Astronaut). Together, they create a sound that’s equal parts danger and dancefloor.Des Demonas instantly caught the attention ofHenry Rollins(KCRW/Black Flag),Marc Riley(BBC6 Music/The Fall), andIggy Pop(BBC6 Music/The Stooges). With their much-anticipated LP Apocalyptic Boom! Boom! (2024), the band doubles down on itsexplosive mix of post-punkswagger,Farfisa-driven garagechaos, andAfro-futuristfervor.As Kim Salmon of The Scientists put it: “The sonic fuel of the band is a blend of post-punk, punk, funk, blues, psych rock, Afrobeat, even bubblegum — but the noise you hear is pure Des Demonas.”Wild, defiant, and full of fire, Des Demonas awaken audiences with their raucous collision of rhythm and rebellion and raw, organ-fueled punk energy! Catch them live at Grauzone Festival 2026 — a rare chance to see one of D.C.’s most electrifying bands bring their righteous fury across the Atlantic. For fans of early The Fall!InstagramBandcampSpotifyDate: tbcTime: tbcLocation: tbc

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] We are delighted to welcome Hamraaz to Grauzone, a duo whose deeply moving exploration of modal and makam traditions creates a musical language that feels both ancient and strikingly contemporary. Formed in Rotterdam in 2021, Hamraaz brings together two extraordinary multi-instrumentalists: Lucie, who grew up with the traditional music of Auvergne and later immersed herself in modal traditions in Istanbul; and Khorshid Dadbeh, an Iranian musician trained in Tar, Setar, and Tanbour with a master’s degree from Codarts and a strong mission to share and evolve Iranian musical heritage.
